title: Jury awards $45 million over alleged abuse of two autistic students by Malibu school aide
dc:creator: Jonah Valdez, Howard Blume
description: The jury found the Santa Monica-Malibu Unified School District liable for alleged abuse that included the use of hand sanitizer to inflict pain.
content:encoded: The jury found the Santa Monica-Malibu Unified School District liable for alleged abuse that included the use of hand sanitizer to inflict pain.

media:content.media:description: MALIBU, CA - NOVEMBER 03: Charles and Nadine Wong won a jury award of $45 million dollars over alleged abuse of their two autistic children at a Malibu school. Photographed on Thursday, Nov. 3, 2022 in Malibu, CA. (Myung J. Chun / Los Angeles Times)
